events.event_description: U.S. biofuels production capacity increased 7% in 2023, reaching 24 billion gallons per year by early 2024, driven by a 44% increase in renewable diesel and other biofuels.
events.citation: Capacity to produce biofuels increased 7% in the United States during 2023, reaching 24 billion gallons per year (gal/y) at the start of 2024, led by a 44% increase in a category we call renewable diesel and other biofuels.

events.event_description: New renewable diesel and biofuel plants began operations in five states, expanding the industry's geographical footprint.
events.citation: New plants started producing renewable diesel and other biofuels in Alabama, California, Louisiana, Pennsylvania, and Washington.

events.event_description: Biodiesel plant closures occurred in multiple states while new facilities opened in Florida and Kentucky, resulting in a small net capacity increase of 3.8 million gallons per year.
events.citation: Even though there were new reporting plants, located in Florida and Kentucky, there were also plant closures in Georgia, Iowa, Oregon, and South Carolina.

events.event_description: U.S. fuel ethanol production capacity grew by 2%, with major capacity concentrated in Midwest states.
events.citation: Fuel ethanol production capacity increased by 2% in the United States between January 2023 and January 2024. The Midwestern states of Iowa, Nebraska, Illinois, South Dakota, Minnesota, and Indiana each have more than 1.4 billion gallons of fuel ethanol production capacity.
